subject: RE: SSO Users
body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

Thank you for your continued patience here! Our Engineering team has made further adjustments. 
 
Could you have Derek attempt signing in again? We were also able to get the Admin role assigned for him. 
 
Stay safe,
Alex Culp
 
 
--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: SHANNON Travis S [tshannon@eugene-or.gov]
Sent: 6/2/2025, 1:17 PM
To: support@flocksafety.com
Subject: RE: SSO Users



I called a bit ago and was able to get Derek�s account reactivated, but it won�t let me assign the Admin role to him. When I edit his profile and click Save, I get an error.

 



 

 

At this point, we�d be totally okay with just deleting the External/SSO created account. There�s no information that we�d lose.

 

In theory, if that account was deleted, the next time he goes to log in, it should link properly with his previously created local account.

 

Derek is training a class on Wednesday, so I gotta get him back in the software by then.

 

 

Thanks!

 

Travis Shannon
Sr. Application Support Technician
Eugene Police Department

300 Country Club Road

Eugene, Oregon 97401
(541)-682-5806

 



 

From: Flock Safety Support <support@flocksafety.com> 
Sent: Monday, June 2, 2025 10:15
To: SHANNON Travis S <TShannon@eugene-or.gov>
Subject: Re: SSO Users

 

[EXTERNAL ?]

Thank you for the follow-up. I sincerely apologize that this issue is persisting. 

 

I have reached back out to our Engineering team for further assistance. I'll let you know as soon as I have another update. 

 

Stay safe,

Alex Culp

Can you please reenable it. 

 

His active directory account is not locked/disabled. 

 

Travis Shannon

Thank you!

When he tries to log in, it says his account is disabled.

 

 

Travis Shannon

--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: SHANNON Travis S [tshannon@eugene-or.gov]
Sent: 5/30/2025, 1:01 PM
To: support@flocksafety.com support@flocksafety.com 
Subject: SSO Users

Good morning,

 

We recently enabled Azure SSO for our account.

 

It looks like a few email addresses were set incorrectly, so when the user went to sign in, SSO created them a new account instead of linking with their old one. Is there a way to �combine� the accounts so users don�t lose their alerts and settings?

 

 

Thanks,

 

Travis Shannon
Sr. Application Support Technician
Eugene Police Department

300 Country Club Road

Eugene, Oregon 97401
(541)-682-5806
